title: Cabiria
brief_description: Cabiria is a 1914 Italian epic silent film, directed by Giovanni Pastrone that laid the foundation for the Hollywood epics that followed. Featuring groundbreaking special effects used to show a volcanic eruption, the film is also famous for inventing the tracking shot.

constellations_other.name: Tracking cinema
constellations_other.description: A constellation looking at the evolution of the tracking / dolly shot.

description: Young Cabiria is kidnapped by pirates and sold as a slave in Carthage. Just as she’s to be sacrificed to Moloch, Cabiria is rescued by Fulvius Axilla, a good-hearted Roman spy, and his powerful slave, Maciste. The trio are broken up and Cabiria is entrusted to woman of noble birth. With Maciste punished for his heroism, Fulvius sent away to fight for Rome, and Cabiria’s fate unknown, is there any hope of our heroes reuniting?
